Package fr.uparis.beryllium.model

Class Itinerary

java.lang.Object
fr.uparis.beryllium.model.Itinerary
public class Itinerary extends Object
Our Itinerary computing class. Contains the algorithm that calculates the best path between two stations given the preference. This itinerary should be unique for each two stations (distinct or not) and therefore there is no need to specify these stations as attributes of this class

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private final ArrayList<Station>
    allStations
    We stock all of our stations here.
    private final HashMap<Station,org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.MutablePair<Station,Line>>
    bestPreviousNeighbors
    This HashMap stocks the best neighbor of each station (and the line to take) to reach the starting point.
    private final HashMap<Station,org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.MutableTriple<Double,Integer,Long>>
    distCountTimeToStart
    This HashMap stocks the best distance, the least amount of stations and the best duration of travel for each station (compared to our fixed starting station)
    private final HashMap<Station,LocalTime>
    itineraryTimes
    For each station we pass through, we store the time at which we boarded the train at that station here

    Computes the shortest path between all pairs of start and dest stations defined in the corresponding arraylists using the shortestWay algorithm on each pair: For each station in start and each station in dest, this method calculates the shortestWay between the two stations, using the corresponding method and returns the best path, depending on the preference specified between all the computed paths.

    • init

      private void init(Station start)
      Method used to initialize the graph of distances, station counts and time between all the stations and our starting point. The three values are initizalized to the MAX_VALUE for all the stations except for the start station which is obviously at 0.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting station

    • bestStationByPreference

      private Station bestStationByPreference(ArrayList<Station> notVisited, int preference)
      Method used to look for the nearest station to our starting point by preference.
      Parameters:
      notVisited - ArrayList of stations didn't visit yet
      preference - 0: shortest distance, 1: best time, 2: closest in the tree
      Returns:
      the closest station to our starting point
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when you choose a preference other than 0, 1 or 2

    • updateDistCountTime

      private void updateDistCountTime(Station station, Integer preference, LocalTime actualTime)
      Gets the best neighbor of station to reach. Updates for each neighbor of station the best way to reach our starting point. Updates distance, count and time for the neighbors. Add this neighbor to the bestPreviousNeighbors HashMap if it's better.
      Parameters:
      station - the station to verify
      preference - 0: shortest distance, 1: best time, 2: closest in the tree
      actualTime -
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when you choose a preference other than 0, 1 or 2

    • shortestWay

      private HashMap<Station,Line> shortestWay(Station start, Station dest, Integer preference, LocalTime timeWeLeft)
      Search for the shortest way to get from a station to another.
      Parameters:
      start - our starting station
      dest - our destination station
      preference - 0: shortest distance, 1: best time, 2: closest in the tree
      Returns:
      the whole path from start to destination in order (LinkedHashMap), null if no path

    • getShortestPath

      private HashMap<Station,Line> getShortestPath(Station start, Station dest)
      This method is called in shortestWay to calculate the shortest path between two stations. This method uses a LinkedHashMap to preserve the order of insertion.
      Parameters:
      start - our starting station
      dest - our destination station
      Returns:
      the whole path from start to destination in order (LinkedHashMap), null if no path

    • shortestMultiplePaths

      public HashMap<Station,Line> shortestMultiplePaths(ArrayList<Station> start, ArrayList<Station> dest, Integer preference, LocalTime timeWeLeft)
      Computes the shortest path between all pairs of start and dest stations defined in the corresponding arraylists using the shortestWay algorithm on each pair: For each station in start and each station in dest, this method calculates the shortestWay between the two stations, using the corresponding method and returns the best path, depending on the preference specified between all the computed paths.
      Parameters:
      start - ArrayList of starting points
      dest - ArrayList of destination points
      preference - 0: shortest distance, 1: best time, 2: closest in the tree
      Returns:
      the best path possible between a station called X and a station called Y
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when you choose a preference other than 0, 1 or 2
      See Also:
      • Station

    • getPathStations

      public LinkedList<Station> getPathStations(HashMap<Station,Line> res)
      This method is used to return an ordered list of all stations in a path
      Parameters:
      res - HashMap of the path calculated by shortestWay Method
      Returns:
      An ordered list of stations in the path (can be empty)

    • getPathLines

      public LinkedList<Line> getPathLines(HashMap<Station,Line> res)
      This method is used to return an ordered list of all the lines in a path
      Parameters:
      res - HashMap of the path calculated by shortestWay Method
      Returns:
      An ordered list of lines in the path (can be empty)

    • getDates

      public LinkedList<LocalTime> getDates(HashMap<Station,Line> res)
      This method is used to return an ordered list of all the times for each station in a path
      Parameters:
      res - HashMap of the path calculated by shortestWay Method
      Returns:
      An ordered list of the times in the path (can be empty)

    • getDistCountTimes

      public LinkedList<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.MutableTriple<Double,Integer,Long>> getDistCountTimes(HashMap<Station,Line> res)
      This method is used to return an ordered list of all distances, amount of stations and best times for each station in a path
      Parameters:
      res - HashMap of the path calculated by shortestWay Method
      Returns:
      An ordered list of all distances, amount of stations and best times in the path (can be empty)

    • getDistTimeForALine

      public org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.MutablePair<Double,Long> getDistTimeForALine(ArrayList<Station> stationRes, ArrayList<Line> lineRes, int position)
      Get distance and time traveled on a line
      Parameters:
      stationRes - list of all the station
      lineRes - list of all the line
      position - the position of the station in the stationRes
      Returns:
      a couple of distance/time which represent the distance and time to travel the line of the station at the position
